definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to do sth when least expected (idiom); to catch sb off guard
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
to open fire/to shoot a gun
lit. to beat a drowning dog (idiom)/fig. to pulverize an (already defeated) enemy/to hit sb when he's down
lit. to appear and disappear unpredictably like a spirit or a ghost (idiom)/fig. elusive
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to stab/to poke/to prod/to nudge/to disclose
to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
to seize an opportunity/to exploit (a loophole)
